option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/MyWallet":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/TransactionHistoryActivity.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `TransactionHistoryActivity` class, which is responsible for displaying the transaction history for a specific user.\\n\\n`TransactionHistoryActivity`: This class extends `AppCompatActivity` and is responsible for displaying the transaction history for a specific user.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is called when the activity is created. It sets up the layout, initializes the `DatabaseHelper` and `TransactionAdapter`, and populates the `RecyclerView` with the user\\u0027s transaction history.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/ExampleUnitTest.java\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test method. It does not contain any other classes or functions.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: This is a unit test class that tests the basic functionality of the application.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: This test method checks that the addition operation is working correctly by asserting that 2 + 2 equals 4.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a simple example of a unit test for an Android application, which can be used as a starting point for writing more comprehensive tests.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/ExampleInstrumentedTest.java\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android app called \\\"MyWallet\\\". It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and checks the context of the app under test.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test method checks if the package name of the app under test matches the expected value.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/LoginActivity.java\":\"`LoginActivity`: This class represents the login activity of the MyWallet application.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is called when the LoginActivity is created, and it sets up the UI elements and event listeners for the login functionality.\\n\\n`onClick(View)`: This function is called when the login button is clicked, and it checks the user\\u0027s credentials against the database and either logs the user in or displays an error message.\\n\\n`onClick(View)`: This function is called when the \\\"Go to Register\\\" button is clicked, and it starts the RegisterActivity.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/DatabaseHelper.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `DatabaseHelper`, which is a helper class for managing a SQLite database for a wallet application.\\n\\n`DatabaseHelper`: A class that extends `SQLiteOpenHelper` to create and manage a SQLite database for a wallet application, including tables for users and transactions.\\n\\n`onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db)`: Creates the necessary tables for the database, including tables for users and transactions.\\n\\n`onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db, int oldVersion, int newVersion)`: Handles database upgrades by adding new columns or tables as needed.\\n\\n`addUser(String username, String password, double balance)`: Adds a new user to the database with the given username, password, and initial balance.\\n\\n`getBalance(String username)`: Retrieves the current balance for the given user.\\n\\n`updateBalance(String username, double newBalance)`: Updates the balance for the given user.\\n\\n`checkUser(String username, String password)`: Checks if the given username and password combination exists in the database.\\n\\n`isUsernameExists(String username)`: Checks if the given username already exists in the database.\\n\\n`addTransaction(String username, double amount, String type)`: Adds a new transaction to the database for the given user, with the specified amount and transaction type.\\n\\n`getTransactions(String username)`: Retrieves a list of all transactions for the given user, ordered by date in descending order.\\n\\n`Transaction`: A nested class that represents a single transaction, with properties for the amount, type, and date.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/RegisterActivity.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `RegisterActivity` class, which is responsible for handling the user registration process in the MyWallet Android application.\\n\\n`RegisterActivity`: This class extends the `AppCompatActivity` and is responsible for handling the user registration process, including validating user input, creating a new user account in the database, and navigating to the login screen upon successful registration.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is called when the `RegisterActivity` is created. It initializes the UI components, sets up the click listeners for the registration and login buttons, and handles the registration process.\\n\\n`onClick(View)`: This function is called when the user clicks the \\\"Register\\\" button. It validates the user input, creates a new user account in the database, and navigates to the login screen upon successful registration.\\n\\n`onClick(View)`: This function is called when the user clicks the \\\"Go to Login\\\" button. It navigates to the `LoginActivity` screen.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/MainActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `MainActivity`, which is the main activity of the Android application. The file also includes several functions that handle the functionality of the application, such as adding money, sending money, and viewing the transaction history.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the Android application that handles the user interface and the core functionality of the wallet application.\\n\\n`updateBalanceDisplay()`: Updates the display of the current balance in the user interface.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: The entry point of the `MainActivity` class, which sets up the user interface and initializes the necessary components.\\n\\n`onClick(View)`: The click event handlers for the \\\"Add Money\\\", \\\"Send Money\\\", and \\\"View History\\\" buttons, which perform the corresponding actions.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/TransactionAdapter.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `TransactionAdapter` class, which is responsible for managing the display of transaction data in a RecyclerView.\\n\\n`TransactionAdapter`: A class that extends `RecyclerView.Adapter` and is responsible for providing the data and views for a list of transactions.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: A function that creates a new `TransactionViewHolder` instance and inflates the view for each item in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: A function that binds the data for a specific transaction to the corresponding views in the `TransactionViewHolder`.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: A function that returns the number of transactions in the list.\\n\\n`TransactionViewHolder`: A static inner class that extends `RecyclerView.ViewHolder` and holds references to the views that display the transaction details.\"}"}
